title: Canada is shifting to 'living with the virus' — for better or worse
Mikaël Kingsbury denied Olympic moguls gold, but earns Canada's 2nd medal in Beijing
Uncivil society: Ottawa's vaccine protest could be a sign of things to come

creator: CBC News
title: Icy storm knocks out power to tens of thousands in Nova Scotia
author: CBC News
content: Thousands of utility customers remained without power early Saturday afternoon amid a storm that brought prolonged periods of freezing rain, ice pellets, rain and snowfall to Nova Scotia.
contentSnippet: Thousands of utility customers remained without power early Saturday afternoon amid a storm that brought prolonged periods of freezing rain, ice pellets, rain and snowfall to Nova Scotia.

title: What the shadow war in Ukraine might say about a possible Russian invasion

creator: Jackson Weaver
title: Why Encanto's We Don't Talk About Bruno is dominating the charts
author: Jackson Weaver
content: Last week, the song We Don’t Talk About Bruno from Disney’s Encanto surpassed Frozen’s smash hit Let It Go to become the highest-charting Disney single since 1995. But how did family-friendly film accomplish it, and what does it mean for the future of pop music charts?
contentSnippet: Last week, the song We Don’t Talk About Bruno from Disney’s Encanto surpassed Frozen’s smash hit Let It Go to become the highest-charting Disney single since 1995. But how did family-friendly film accomplish it, and what does it mean for the future of pop music charts?

creator: Mark Gollom
title: People are severing friendships over convoy protest, with some saying it shows 'true colours'
author: Mark Gollom
content: The convoy protest has added a new strain on relationships and prompted some to sever their friendships with rally supporters. That's because the protest touches on core values for many — values that you hold that are so important, they can't be compromised, a psychologist says.
contentSnippet: The convoy protest has added a new strain on relationships and prompted some to sever their friendships with rally supporters. That's because the protest touches on core values for many — values that you hold that are so important, they can't be compromised, a psychologist says.

title: Protesters denouncing pandemic rules rallying across Canada

creator: John Paul Tasker
title: Canada needs to adopt a 'more sustainable' approach to COVID-19, Tam says
author: John Paul Tasker
content: Canada's top doctor said today the country needs to find a more "sustainable" way to deal with the COVID-19 pandemic and future variants of the virus.
contentSnippet: Canada's top doctor said today the country needs to find a more "sustainable" way to deal with the COVID-19 pandemic and future variants of the virus.

creator: Margaret Evans
title: Boris Johnson's scandals undermine U.K.'s reputation abroad during diplomatic push
author: Margaret Evans
content: Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s trip to Ukraine on Tuesday had little chance of being portrayed as anything other than a flight from his domestic woes — and potentially an ill-judged one.
contentSnippet: Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s trip to Ukraine on Tuesday had little chance of being portrayed as anything other than a flight from his domestic woes — and potentially an ill-judged one.

creator: The Associated Press
title: Minneapolis mayor halts no-knock entries after police fatally shoot Black man Amir Locke
author: The Associated Press
content: The Minneapolis mayor imposed a moratorium on no-knock warrants Friday, two days after a SWAT team entered an apartment and killed Amir Locke, a 22-year-old Black man who his parents said was "executed" after he was startled from a deep sleep and reached for a legal firearm to protect himself.
contentSnippet: The Minneapolis mayor imposed a moratorium on no-knock warrants Friday, two days after a SWAT team entered an apartment and killed Amir Locke, a 22-year-old Black man who his parents said was "executed" after he was startled from a deep sleep and reached for a legal firearm to protect himself.

creator: The Associated Press
title: U.S. death toll from COVID-19 hits 900,000, propelled by Omicron
author: The Associated Press
content: Propelled in part by the wildly contagious Omicron variant, the U.S. death toll from COVID-19 hit 900,000 on Friday, less than two months after eclipsing 800,000.
contentSnippet: Propelled in part by the wildly contagious Omicron variant, the U.S. death toll from COVID-19 hit 900,000 on Friday, less than two months after eclipsing 800,000.

title: Protesters at Coutts, Alta., blockade move in to block southbound lane to U.S. border

creator: Reuters
title: World's 2nd largest trawler dumps 100,000 dead fish into Atlantic Ocean
author: Reuters
content: Dutch-owned trawler FV Margiris, the world's second-biggest fishing vessel, shed more than 100,000 dead fish into the Atlantic Ocean off France, forming a floating carpet of carcasses that was spotted by environmental campaigners.
contentSnippet: Dutch-owned trawler FV Margiris, the world's second-biggest fishing vessel, shed more than 100,000 dead fish into the Atlantic Ocean off France, forming a floating carpet of carcasses that was spotted by environmental campaigners.

creator: Jenna Benchetrit
title: Brands are cashing in on Lunar New Year — and working with Asian-Canadian creatives is key
author: Jenna Benchetrit
content: Canadian brands like Holt Renfrew and Nobis have released Lunar New Year collections, as many luxury brands eye China's growing consumer market. But how do companies create long-lasting community relationships while commercializing the holiday?
contentSnippet: Canadian brands like Holt Renfrew and Nobis have released Lunar New Year collections, as many luxury brands eye China's growing consumer market. But how do companies create long-lasting community relationships while commercializing the holiday?

title: Reflecting on the life and legacy of Howard McCurdy: scientist, activist and politician

creator: CBC News
title: PC brand Lemon & Ginger Sicilian Soda recalled due to possible 'extraneous' glass
author: CBC News
content: Loblaw Companies Ltd. is recalling PC brand Lemon & Ginger Sicilian Soda from the marketplace due to the possible presence of "extraneous" glass, says the Canadian Food Inspection Agency.
contentSnippet: Loblaw Companies Ltd. is recalling PC brand Lemon & Ginger Sicilian Soda from the marketplace due to the possible presence of "extraneous" glass, says the Canadian Food Inspection Agency.

creator: CBC News
title: Nurses in COVID-19 unit at Health Sciences North in Sudbury celebrate $585K jackpot in 50/50 draw
author: CBC News
content: Health-care workers in the respiratory care unit at Sudbury, Ont.'s Health Sciences North won $585,472 in a 50/50 draw that was split between 19 people.
contentSnippet: Health-care workers in the respiratory care unit at Sudbury, Ont.'s Health Sciences North won $585,472 in a 50/50 draw that was split between 19 people.

creator: Peter Zimonjic
title: Cracks appear in Conservative caucus over anti-vaccine mandate protest
author: Peter Zimonjic
content: After a week that saw the new interim leader of the federal Conservatives and other high-profile Tory MPs throw their support behind the anti-vaccine mandate protest convoy snarling Ottawa's downtown core, one of the party's Quebec MPs is breaking ranks and calling the protest a "siege."
contentSnippet: After a week that saw the new interim leader of the federal Conservatives and other high-profile Tory MPs throw their support behind the anti-vaccine mandate protest convoy snarling Ottawa's downtown core, one of the party's Quebec MPs is breaking ranks and calling the protest a "siege."

creator: Florence Hwang
title: Sask. woman survives 14-hour ordeal in swirling blizzard with help from nearby stranger
author: Florence Hwang
content: An 80-year-old retiree walked through the blizzard to rescue seven stranded travellers.
contentSnippet: An 80-year-old retiree walked through the blizzard to rescue seven stranded travellers.

creator: Michael Lee
title: Hundreds more trucks expected in Ottawa as 'freedom convoy' protests spread beyond capital
dc:creator: Michael Lee
content: More rallies protesting COVID-19 vaccine mandates and other pandemic restrictions will get underway today in Ottawa and several other major cities in Canada.
contentSnippet: More rallies protesting COVID-19 vaccine mandates and other pandemic restrictions will get underway today in Ottawa and several other major cities in Canada.

creator: CTVNews.ca
title: Latest updates: Protests in Ottawa and provincial capitals
dc:creator: CTVNews.ca
content: Authorities in Ottawa are bracing for the 'freedom convoy' protest to swell to the tune of hundreds more trucks and thousands more demonstrators on Saturday.
contentSnippet: Authorities in Ottawa are bracing for the 'freedom convoy' protest to swell to the tune of hundreds more trucks and thousands more demonstrators on Saturday.

creator: Glen McGregor
title: Lawsuit filed against convoy organizers, seeking damages on behalf of downtown Ottawa residents
dc:creator: Glen McGregor
content: Organizers of the 'Freedom Convoy' that has gridlocked downtown Ottawa for the last week are facing a potential $9.8-million class-action lawsuit over continuous vehicle horn noise, filed on behalf of residents of the city's downtown core.
contentSnippet: Organizers of the 'Freedom Convoy' that has gridlocked downtown Ottawa for the last week are facing a potential $9.8-million class-action lawsuit over continuous vehicle horn noise, filed on behalf of residents of the city's downtown core.

creator: Reuters
title: Florida governor to investigate GoFundMe over Ottawa trucker donations
dc:creator: Reuters
content: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis said on Saturday it was fraud for GoFundMe to 'commandeer' $10 million in donations sent to support the 'Freedom Convoy' in Ottawa and that he will investigate what he called 'deceptive practices' by the website.
contentSnippet: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis said on Saturday it was fraud for GoFundMe to 'commandeer' $10 million in donations sent to support the 'Freedom Convoy' in Ottawa and that he will investigate what he called 'deceptive practices' by the website.

creator: Brooklyn Neustaeter
title: Trump calls Trudeau 'far left lunatic,' expresses support for convoy
dc:creator: Brooklyn Neustaeter
content: Former U.S. president Donald Trump has issued a statement criticizing Prime Minister Justin Trudeau over vaccine mandates and expressing support for the trucker convoy protests happening across Canada.
contentSnippet: Former U.S. president Donald Trump has issued a statement criticizing Prime Minister Justin Trudeau over vaccine mandates and expressing support for the trucker convoy protests happening across Canada.

creator: The Canadian Press
title: CFIA canned potato review irritates farmers and shows depths of government secrecy
dc:creator: The Canadian Press
content: The Canadian Food Inspection Agency wants to know what people think about the size of canned, cubed, white potatoes. But if you want to know exactly who asked for the change or why this is a priority exercise, you're out of luck.
contentSnippet: The Canadian Food Inspection Agency wants to know what people think about the size of canned, cubed, white potatoes. But if you want to know exactly who asked for the change or why this is a priority exercise, you're out of luck.

creator: The Canadian Press
title: Canada's Kingsbury wins moguls silver at Olympics, just shy of back-to-back titles
dc:creator: The Canadian Press
content: Canadian freestyle skier Mikael Kingsbury has been dethroned. Kingsbury, the defending champion, settled for moguls silver with a score of 82.18 at the Beijing Olympics after being upset by Sweden's Walter Wallberg in Saturday's final.
contentSnippet: Canadian freestyle skier Mikael Kingsbury has been dethroned. Kingsbury, the defending champion, settled for moguls silver with a score of 82.18 at the Beijing Olympics after being upset by Sweden's Walter Wallberg in Saturday's final.

creator: Sean Davidson
title: Ontario reports another drop in COVID-19 hospitalizations
dc:creator: Sean Davidson
content: Ontario is reporting another drop in the number of people in hospital with COVID-19 as pandemic pressure on the province's health-care system continues to ease.
contentSnippet: Ontario is reporting another drop in the number of people in hospital with COVID-19 as pandemic pressure on the province's health-care system continues to ease.

creator: The Associated Press
title: Russian bombers fly over Belarus amid Ukraine tensions
dc:creator: The Associated Press
content: Russia on Saturday sent a pair of long-range nuclear-capable bombers on patrol over its ally Belarus amid spiraling tensions over Ukraine.
contentSnippet: Russia on Saturday sent a pair of long-range nuclear-capable bombers on patrol over its ally Belarus amid spiraling tensions over Ukraine.

creator: The Canadian Press
title: Canadian speedskater Weidemann wins Olympic bronze in women's 3,000
dc:creator: The Canadian Press
content: Canada made its mark on the medal table early at the Beijing Olympics, as speedskater Isabelle Weidemann raced to bronze in the women's 3,000 metres on Saturday.
contentSnippet: Canada made its mark on the medal table early at the Beijing Olympics, as speedskater Isabelle Weidemann raced to bronze in the women's 3,000 metres on Saturday.
